title: A Quick Chicken Recipe That Gets the Spice Just Right
sub_head: This pulao recipe builds flavor at every step, producing a comforting meal of chicken and rice infused with warming spices.
body:
TOO OFTEN in New York, chef Chintan Pandya finds dishes he grew up with in Mumbai rendered unrecognizable. Sometimes, even the name is wrong. “What is often served as biryani is in fact pulao,” the chef said
Unlike biryani, a more elaborate, time-consuming rice dish, a pulao comes together quickly. This recipe, made with chicken thighs, basmati rice, ginger, garlic, onions, tomatoes and warming spices, is a streamlined version of one served at Mr. Pandya’s Manhattan restaurant Dhamaka.
